topics.author: 4fe4bf947f123b175b000001

topics.body:
I realized something odd; no matter how much I eat or how much I fast or exercise I still maintain my same body weight of 154 lbs.

I've weighed 154 lbs ever since I was 15 and still weigh the same exact weight, the same height and look the same even though(just with much longer hair).  It's been nine years too.  I use to play baseball and sports all the time and I still weigh the same as I do now.

The longest I ever went without food, other than bread, was two weeks I think and I still weighed the same.  Even scarfing down on a all you can eat buffet doesn't add any extra pounds either.  I could swallow a double chocolate cake; it wouldn't add any pounds to my stomach at all and I'd still be perfectly healthy regardless.

It's not just my weight, height or how I look either; my family ages extremely slowly.  My great-grandmother was 90-something, looked like she was sixty, was always outside taking care of her garden and totally self-sufficient.  My grandmother is about seventy and before she destroyed herself abusing drugs she looked about forty and was active.  My mom is 55, looks thirty and is still physically fit enough to do more physical activity than someone half her age.

I didn't just win the genetic lottery; I won the genetic multimillion lottery.  That means I'm going to be one of those people that pushes well past a hundred, still looks young, just with gray hair(no baldness isn't in my family either) and still fit enough to take care of myself.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/533c7853636872133b700300#post_533c7853636872133b700300
(Epiphany)
Hmmmm, the hermit lifestyle is sounding more and more tempting to me.  No one ever bothers hermits.  I could do it too; just work a couple years, pay off school loans and build a single room house that's heavily insulated, have a garden, live on a mountain and work only a couple hours a month just for basics.

I'd be one of those people that if the world went to complete shit and everyone nuked each other I wouldn't notice at all.  I'd be up on my mountain wondering why the internet is down and why no one is coming to fix it.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/533c7d3263687249cf870200#post_533c7d3263687249cf870200

all i need is a house, food, money and internet in my life. guess having simple goals in life can pay off at the end.
topics.author: 5154c5237f123bcd580002fc

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/533c7e8f6368724742970100#post_533c7e8f6368724742970100
Having simple goals is the best goal; the reason being is the more and more you desire the more and more you need to obtain to fulfil those desires.

To put it simply:  If you want to become a billionaire then that's going to take a metric fuck ton of effort and spending decades of your life if you weren't born a billionaire.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

i got my life plan done already.

finish college, move to canada or any other country more politically stable that speaks english and doesnt privatize its healthcare, become a criminal investigator maybe (this part can change) live in a calm place like a suburb that its not far form work (this obviusly excludes capitals, too habitated.) and live like that for the rest of my life, working then playing videogames in the rest, buying co-op games to enjoy with some internet buddies.
